title: Progressive Arevalo leads in poll ahead of Guatemala presidential election
description: A survey from CID Gallup shows Bernardo Arevalo surging ahead of conservative rival Sandra Torres in lead-up to vote.

title: US appeals court upholds limits on access to abortion pill mifepristone
description: The latest ruling over mifepristone's FDA approval is likely to send the pill's fate to the US Supreme Court.

title: Scientists celebrate as pig kidney continues to function in human body
description: Surgeons hope that cross-species organ transplants could eventually help save lives of human patients.

title: British Museum sacks employee over ‘missing, stolen or damaged’ items
description: Items included gold jewellery and gems and glass dating from 15th century BCE to the 19th century.

title: H&M probes alleged Myanmar factory abuses as pressure intensifies
description: A human rights group tracked 156 cases of alleged worker abuse in Myanmar garment factories at various brands.

title: Death toll in Dominican Republic explosion rises to 25 as blaze continues
description: The cause of the deadly explosion remains unknown, though officials have vowed to pursue accountability in the case.

title: How far can women’s football go?
description: Women's World Cup 2023 in Australia and New Zealand has smashed ticket sales and TV audience records.

title: Dozens feared dead after boat capsizes off Cape Verde
description: UN migration agency says 38 refugees and migrants rescued and 63 others believed to have died.

title: Libya fighting leaves 55 dead, dozens injured: Medics
description: Fighting between rival groups began on Monday night in Tripoli, and ended after the release of a commander on Tuesday.

title: Extended injury time, no dancing keepers: The Premier League’s new rules
description: Changes to added time, offside and dissent are some of the amendments made to the Premier League rule book.

title: ‘I was given six days to wrap up my life’: Russia expels Politico reporter
description: Eva Hartog, a Dutch citizen, says she is the latest victim of Russia's crackdown on foreign journalists.

title: Catholic Church in South Africa begins class action against mining firms
description: The church says it filed the case after it was approached by mine workers for help.

title: Haiti’s crisis deepens as thousands displaced by violence
description: More than 3,000 people have fled their homes amid growing violence in neighbourhoods of Port-au-Prince, UN agency says.

title: US divided along party lines over Trump election cases: Poll
description: Majority of Americans view ex-president unfavourably, but Donald Trump has strong support among Republicans, poll shows.

title: The all-women Arab bands blazing a trail in Jordan and Egypt
description: Two all-women bands are empowering themselves across the Arab world, Naya from Jordan and The Lady’s Drum in Egypt.

title: Dozens injured as Israeli forces raid Nablus, blow up building
description: Israeli forces say they destroyed a bomb-making lab in Balata refugee camp, but residents said homes were destroyed.

title: Mobs burn Christian churches, homes in Pakistan after blasphemy allegations
description: Hundreds of people armed with batons and sticks attack churches in Jaranwala after the Quran was allegedly desecrated.

title: England stun hosts Australia 3-1 to reach Women’s World Cup final
description: Lionesses end the Matildas' run to reach the Women's World Cup final for the first time and set up a clash with Spain.

title: Thousands of Cuban migrants face uncertainty in Uruguay
description: Families waiting to apply for permanent residency say Uruguay’s new visa requirements are jeopardising their future.

title: Congressman Ro Khanna slammed for meeting Hindutva ideologue on India visit
description: US Congressman Ro Khanna has come under fire for meeting a far-right ideologue on his trip to India.

title: Afghans fled for a better future but 2 years later, it’s a dream for most
description: Millions of Afghans who have left their country since 2021 remain stuck in limbo as they seek to reach Western nations.

title: ‘Traumatic’ trend: Ransom kidnappings thrive in South Africa as crime soars
description: Police say kidnappings rose from 3,832 cases in 2013 to nearly 11,000 cases in 2021, with most of those in Gauteng.

title: Ethnic Violence in Manipur
description: “I've never felt this helpless as a reporter.”

title: India and China pledge to maintain ‘peace and tranquility’ along border
description: In a statement, Beijing and New Delhi say they have 'agreed to resolve the remaining issues in an expeditious manner'.

title: The Killers decried for asking Russian fan to play drums at Georgia concert
description: Georgians, infuriated by Russia's war in Ukraine and occupation of their land, say the US band's move was naive at best.

title: England’s Ben Stokes comes out of ODI retirement ahead of Cricket World Cup
description: The star of England's 2019 Cricket World Cup win has been included in the ODI squad for a series against New Zealand.

title: UK annual inflation drops to 15-month low, eases cost-of-living crisis
description: As lower energy prices prompt annual inflation to drop in July, PM Sunak says the figures show 'the plan is working'.

title: UN: One million people flee Sudan as situation ‘spirals out of control’
description: The war causes 1,017,449 people to leave Sudan for neighbouring countries and displaces 3,433,025 internally.

title: Kenyan designers make fashion statement against textile waste
description: Nairobi's fashion community uses secondhand clothing market as their inspiration and backdrop.

title: Biden should learn from Lula’s antiracism
description: At present, Black lives matter even less in Brazil than they do in the US, but Lula is taking action to change that.

title: School or food? A Pakistani mother’s dilemma
description: Amid crippling inflation, a domestic worker in Pakistan sometimes forgoes meals so that her children can study and eat.

title: Drilling rig arrives in Lebanon’s Block 9 to begin exploration
description: The drilling became possible after a US-mediated deal settled a maritime border dispute in Lebanese and Israeli waters.

title: More than a dozen Niger soldiers killed in attack near Mali border
description: The Nigerien Defence Ministry says another 20 soldiers were wounded in the attack.

title: Death toll hits 106 in Hawaii wildfires, number expected to rise
description: Maui authorities have confirmed 106 deaths as painstaking recovery and identification work continues.

title: Hundreds evacuated in India’s Himalayan state amid monsoon mayhem
description: Rain and landslides kill at least 60 as more than 800 people evacuated from low-lying areas of Himachal Pradesh state.

title: Syria to Libya, then Europe: How people smugglers operate
description: Syrians fleeing their homes first head to migrant hub Libya before navigating the world's deadliest migration route.

title: The true face of Israel’s protest movement

title: Thai court rejects Move Forward’s challenge to derailed prime minister bid
description: The decision all but kills off any hope of the election-winning party from leading the next government.

title: Lidia Thorpe says Australia’s voice referendum should be called off

title: Latvia sends soldiers to boost security on border with Belarus
description: Latvia says country is facing increased 'hybrid threats' and blames Belarus on involvement in border crossings.

title: Taiwan VP says China military action to US stopover would be interference
description: Self-ruled island that Beijing claims as its own is due to go to the polls in January with VP Lai the frontrunner.

title: How India’s ban on some rice exports is ricocheting around the world
description: India's decision to ban exports of some rice was based on domestic reasons, but it's had a global impact.

title: Three Bulgarians arrested in UK linked to suspected Russian espionage
description: Trio suspected of working for Russian security service charged with possession of false identity documents, police say.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 539
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 539th day.

title: N Korea says US soldier crossed border seeking refuge from racism

title: Russian drones threaten Ukraine’s key Danube River ports
description: Russian drones said to have entered Danube River area and air defences heard near ports of Izmail and Reni: Reports

title: Poland holds huge military parade as war rages in neighbouring Ukraine
description: Poland's Armed Forces Day parade marked the 103rd anniversary of victory over the Soviet Union in the Battle of Warsaw.

title: Human rights commission denounces murder of third politician in Ecuador
description: The Inter-American Commission on Human Rights urges solutions to the political violence unfolding before the elections.
